metadata.title: Oceanographic Survey of the Southern Coastal Area of Korea

creators.name: Development Institute (NFRDI), Korean Oceanographic Data Center (KODC)

metadata.description:
Oceanographic surveys have been conducted at 175 stations (22 lines) in the Bering Sea from 1972 to 1981.  Data collected 10 to 12 times a year include fish larvae and eggs, temperature, salinity, DO, phytoplankton, and zooplankton.  Data obtained from the surveys have been published as "Annual report of oceanographic observations" and are available through the Korean Oceanographic Data Center (KODC).  

[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To extend and evaluate potential fishing grounds and to access marine environmental quality.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: None.

Use constraints: Contact Source.
